title: Hyperostosis Frontalis Interna
short_description: A clinical document describing hyperostosis frontalis interna, a condition characterized by thickening of the frontal skull bone that predominantly affects females.
long_description: This clinical document provides a comprehensive overview of hyperostosis frontalis interna, a medical condition involving the thickening of the frontal bone of the skull. The document discusses the prevalence of this disorder, noting that it may affect up to 12% of the female population and is nine times more common in females than males. It details the various associated conditions including seizures, headaches, obesity, diabetes insipidus, excessive hair growth, and endocrine disturbances. The document also covers laboratory findings such as elevated serum alkaline phosphatase and calcium levels, and notes that while the condition most commonly presents in middle-aged and elderly individuals, it can also occur in adolescents.
